text:
He stretched on the sofa, unable to sleep. 

Day-dreams haunted him. 

In one, he was in Africa, an oasis. 

The caravan rested. Camels lay peacefully. 

He drank from a cool spring. 

Suddenly, a clock struck. 

He jumped up, wide awake. 

His heart raced. 

He crept to the door, listening. 

Silence filled the staircase. 

He felt monstrous for sleeping so long. 

It could be six already. 

Panic surged through him. 

He rummaged under his pillow. 

He needed a noose for his overcoat. 

Time was slipping away.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Haunted by day-dreams and a sense of urgency, the protagonist struggles with his thoughts and preparations for an impending action.
